Jake Miller was bored. Bored, bored, bored. He was bored at school, bored at home, and bored
everywhere else. His family was always the same, his friends were always the same, and his
classes were always the same. He often wished that things would change. Little did he
know...
One boring day, Jake was walking home when something strange caught his eye. He looked
around, and discovered a scrap of color, almost obscured by a large bush, lying in the ditch
at the side of the road. Intrigued for some reason, Jake moved closer to it, so he gould get
a better look. It was a light blue shoebox, with 'X-39' sloppily scrawled on it in black
marker. Jake knelt down to pull it out of its spot in the bush, and as he touched it, he
felt a strange sense of... rightness. Somehow, he knew that this was what he was looking
for. This was the answer to his boredom. Excitedly, Jake stuffed the box into his backpack
and hurried back to his house.
Once he got home, he ran straight up to his room, ignoring his father's greeting from the
other room. He shut the door to his room, ensuring that his bratty sister wouldn't bother
him while he examined his discovery. Gingerly, he opened the box and dumped its contents
onto his bed. Inside was a strange device, about the size and shape of a TV remote, but a
little lighter. It had three buttons, marked 'Gender', 'Swap', and 'Copy/Paste', as well as
a number of smaller buttons. There was also an illuminated screen, divided into five
sections- 'Body', 'Clothes', 'Mind', 'Life', and 'Other'. Also inside was a small sheet of
paper and a large instruction manual. Jake picked up the paper and read it.
'Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of an X-39 Attribute Alterator, the latest in
alteration technology! The X-39 is an amazing and powerful device, capable of changing
people in a limitless number of ways. And the best part is, they won't even realize it! The
X-39's patented RealityLok(tm) feature ensures that the people you change think they've
always been that way. Only you know the difference!'

Jake grinned. This was an amazing find. He wouldn't be bored now!

Feeling the nicotine coursing through his veins, Jake acknowledged that Sarah was right; he didn't want to quit any time soon, either. Besides, he knew in truth what most smokers only told themselves as a convenient lie: he could quit any time he wanted. In the meantime, why not enjoy his new habit?

"I do want to keep at this for a while, but I have a problem you don't have. Nobody smokes at my house. I guess eventually we'll have to work out a way to get our own supply, but just for now, could you give me some out of Samantha's pack?" Jake asked sheepishly.

"Yes. I want more for myself, and besides, you caused this. I get to keep the lighter, too." she added, a little defensively.

Jake began to formulate a counter argument, but stopped himself. This wasn't worth falling out over, and besides, two cigarettes was more than the none he'd have otherwise.

With that, the two set off in different directions for their respective homes. As Jake walked home, he began to wonder about the possibilities inherent in the remote. He also reflected on his new addiction; ironically, he and his sister Allison had just a few short years ago persuaded their mother to quit smoking herself, after years of pressure. He wondered how his mother would react to his hypocrisy, now he was a smoker? He hoped to delay that reckoning as long as possible.

As he entered his house, Jake realised he had underestimated the strength of his addiction. He already wanted another cigarette, but knew it would be some time before he got the opportunity. Throughout the family meal, he grew ever more preoccupied and irritable, and wished that his remote could make time go faster somehow.

By the time everyone else was safely in bed, Jake no longer wanted a cigarette, he NEEDED one. He had worked out his plan of attack: the family kept a lighter in the kitchen drawer to light candles on birthdays and such, so he would procure that as his new lighter. Then he would hide in the trees at the end of the garden.

He was less stealthy than he had hoped to be, as by now he was feeling desperate and uncoordinated. He was almost shaking; he had never known deprivation like this! Fumbling with his lighter briefly, he felt immense relief as his cigarette lit, and a sense of blissful well-being as the smoke entered his lungs. If he had never known what it was to be deprived until earlier, he had never know release until this moment. He devoured the cigarette almost without noticing, and as he crushed it out beneath his sneaker he realised he still did not feel quite right.

Frowning, he examined the second cigarette. He knew he needed it, right now. He also knew that it represented the end of his supply. He momentarily considered saving it, but before he quite knew it his will had collapsed, the cigarette was lit, and he was exhaling his first drag. Had he once known freedom, willpower? All he knew in that moment was that he needed to smoke, and to solve the lack of cigarettes, fast.

Suddenly, an idea hit Jake: his mother used to smoke! If he pasted the addiction back onto her, it would be reasonably assumed she'd just relapsed. Few eyebrows would be raised. That would give him a supply to loot, and also set a less contentious scene for his own inevitable debut as a smoker. And unlike with Sarah, his conscience would be clear; his mother chose to smoke already, so all he was doing was reinforcing that choice.

He'd half talked himself into this plan before the nicotine began to work it's magic, and return him to his senses. In a more rational state, he felt a little ashamed that he'd decided to do such a morally ambiguous thing simply to serve his own addiction. As he blew away the last of his smoke, he closed his eyes and made a decision...

You and I got Mom to quit smoking years ago; nobody in this house smoked until the last two days. Oh, and Zoe is really an athletic guy named Zach." he said in mock sincerity.

I feel like there's some sweet side to her that's just gone. Is it all your fault, for real?"

Jake found himself feeling strangely sad, ashamed. It moved him to hear his sister speaking of him in positive terms, even as a half remembered shade. Who would say that about the new him? He looked at the floor, which Allison took as an affirmative response.

"Jake, you have to set it all right. You can, can't you? So set it right!" she implored.

"Oh come on, she wasn't exactly quiet. I know what you just did." said Allison mockingly. "And unless you put everything back, so will Sarah, very soon."

A rage built within Jake. She'd just found out the power he held, and she thought THREATS were a good idea. That wouldn't do. Bitch had to learn.

Jake theatrically aimed the remote and started conspicuously applying settings. Allison looked nervous, but managed to remain assertive.

"What are you going to do Jake, make me a smoker like Zoe? I'll resist, I'm not so weak minded."

You'll reach ebbs so low that neither of us can imagine them, and you'll be too confused and addled to do anything about it. But like you say, you have a stronger will than most. Not so conspicuously or as instantaneously as usual; he'd just subtly nudge their traits towards it, make one or two recent secret smokers. Nothing so far removed from normal teenage experimentation that Allison would know that it wasn't exactly that. Of course, she'd still be just as sanctimonious about it all at first, but not to him.

And as all her friends changed around her, let's see how well the little bitch handled good old fashioned peer pressure. She'd either eventually cave or end up totally alone and miserable. Either outcome was fine by him, thought Jake with a savage grin.
